news: Brighthouse Financial (BHF) surged 24.9% after Berkshire Hathaway reported a record $381.7 billion cash pile and strong Q3 operating profits, boosting investor confidence in insurance sector stability.

Illumina (ILMN) jumped 24.8% following its Q3 earnings beat: $1.084B revenue (in-line YoY) and $1.34 EPS vs. $1.17 expected. Company raised full-year EPS guidance to $4.65–$4.75 from $4.45–$4.55, citing improved clinical demand and cost controls.

Alphatec Holdings (ATEC) rose 16.3% after reporting better-than-expected Q3 results with strong spinal implant sales growth and positive commentary on market share gains in the U.S. orthopedics sector.
